subject: Gardening
title: Levels and Terracing
description: A fast breakdown of Levels and Terracing for builders.

hook.text: A flat garden shows everything at once. Add a single stepâ€”just six inchesâ€”and the space transforms with depth.

buildup.text: Changes in level create separate zones, add drama, improve drainage, and make flat sites feel more dynamic.

discovery.text: The Renaissance perfected terracing. Villa d'Este cascades through levels of water and stone like a theater.

twist.text: Even minimal level changes work. A sunken seating area just 18 inches below grade feels like a secret room.

climax.text: Vertical change is the most underused design tool. A few inches of height difference creates more impact than any plant.

punchline.text: Six inches of height change transforms a flat garden.

quiz.question: Why is even a small change in garden level so impactful?
options: It creates better drainage for plants at both levels
It creates separate zones and adds depth that transforms flat spaces
It prevents visitors from running through the garden too quickly
